description: Mid 15th century, in sense “mischievous, pernicious”, from Latin pestiferus (“bearing plague”), from pestifer, from pestis (“plague”) + ferre (“carry”) (see infer).

adjectives.description: pestiferous (comparative more pestiferous, superlative most pestiferous)

entries.meaning: containing organisms that cause contagious diseases

examples: and if any could have hanged his hindering and pestiferous council and set him free, he would have answered Joan's prayer and set her in the field.
